secretion system¶

represent a secretion system. it’s defined by a definition file in xml stored in the xml syntax is

for instance:

<system>
    <gene name="sctJ_FLG" presence="mandatory">
       <homologs>
           <gene name="sctJ" system_ref="T2SS"/>
           <gene name="pilO" system_ref="T2SS" aligned="true"/>
       </homologs>
    </gene>
    <gene name="sctN_FLG" presence="mandatory"/>
    <gene name="sctQ_FLG" presence="mandatory"/>
    <gene name="sctR_FLG" presence="mandatory"/>
    <gene name="sctS_FLG" presence="mandatory"/>
    <gene name="sctT_FLG" presence="mandatory"/>
    <gene name="sctU_FLG" presence="mandatory"/>
    <gene name="sctV_FLG" presence="mandatory"/>
    <gene name="flgB" presence="allowed"/>
    <gene name="flgC" presence="allowed"/>
    <gene name="fliE" presence="allowed"/>
    <gene name="sctC" presence="forbidden"/>
</system>

a system_parser is used to build a system object from it’s xml definition

a system as a name based on the file name of the xml definition and 3 kind of genes lists in function of their presence:

  • The genes which must be present in the genome to defined this system.
  • The genes which can be presents but not in all cases.
  • The genes which must not be present.

SystemFactory API reference¶

class txsscanlib.system.SystemFactory¶

build and cached all systems objects. Systems must not be instanciate directly. the system_factory must be used. The system factory ensure there is only one instance of system for a given name. To get a system use the method get_system. if the gene is already cached this instance is returned otherwise a new system is build, cached then returned.

__weakref__¶

list of weak references to the object (if defined)

get_system(name, cfg)¶
Returns:return system corresponding to the name.

If the system already exists return it otherwise build it an d returni :rtype: txsscanlib.system.System object

Note

Don’t instanciate your own SystemFactory use the system_factory at the top level of the module.

from txsscanlib.system import system_factory
t2ss =  system_factory.get_system("T2SS", config)

System API reference¶

class txsscanlib.system.System(name, cfg)[source]¶

handle a secretion system.

__init__(name, cfg)[source]¶
Parameters:
  • name (string) – the name of the system
  • cfg (txsscanlib.config.Config object) – the configuration
__weakref__¶

list of weak references to the object (if defined)

add_allowed_gene(gene)[source]¶

add a gene in the list of allowed genes

Parameters:gene (txsscanlib.secretion.Gene object) – gene which should be present in this system
add_forbidden_gene(gene)[source]¶

add a gene in the list of forbidden genes

Parameters:gene (txsscanlib.secretion.Gene object) – gene which must not be present in this system
add_mandatory_gene(gene)[source]¶

add a gene in the list of mandatory genes

Parameters:gene (txsscanlib.secretion.Gene object) – gene which are mandatory for this system
allowed_genes[source]¶
Returns:the list of genes which should be present in this secretion system
Return type:list of txsscanlib.secretion.Gene object
forbidden_genes[source]¶
Returns:the list of genes which cannot be present in this secretion system
Return type:list of txsscanlib.secretion.Gene objects
mandatory_genes[source]¶
Returns:the list of genes which are mandatory for this secretion system
Return type:list of txsscanlib.secretion.Gene object
